info.title: Ez Scan
info.description:
[More](https://ezmcom.bitbucket.io/idproofing) on document text extraction and text structuring.
[How](https://ezmcom.bitbucket.io/idproofing) to use this tool
[Download](https://www.ezmcom.com/store/openAPI/3.0/sampleRequest/sample_request.json) sample data packet

get.description: returns the details of the license installed on the server such as the number of pages that can still be scanned with the license

200.description: Success, prints the licenses available on the installed instance in the tomcat logs

post.description: Verifies the service setup by loading the configurations and resources required.

200.description: Success, returns the body sent to the API along with max allowed AES Key Length

post.description: using the datapacket generated from the SDK, this API is used to OCR the scanned document
similar to the above mentioned ezscan, just with versioning in the URI
using the datapacket generated from the SDK, this API is used to OCR the scanned document. Needs to be enabled manually in the setup, since this supports non-encrypted datapackets
using the datapacket generated from the SDK, this API is used to OCR the scanned document.
using the datapacket generated from the SDK, this API is used to OCR the scanned document. Needs to be enabled manually in the setup, since this supports non-encrypted datapackets
can be used to print logs to the server from client

log4meBody.description: sample body that can be used to print to the logs

key.description: key/tag of the value that has been sent to be printed to the logs

value.description: value that needs to be printed

c.description: optional encrypted data, generated by SDK

d.description: optional encrypted data, generated by SDK

e.description: document type { for a list of documents supported [click here](https://ezmcom.bitbucket.io/idproofing#documentCodesID) }

f.description: unique ID / session ID that uniquely identifies the OCR transaction

items.description: an array of base64 encoded images, where index -> 0 holds the first page of the document and vice versa

k.description: optional, string cast value of the JSON response from offline OCR SDK

response_code.description: for a list of response codes supported [click here](https://ezmcom.bitbucket.io/idproofing#responseCodesMessagesID)

response_message.description: for a list of response messages supported [click here](https://ezmcom.bitbucket.io/idproofing#responseCodesMessagesID)

human_faces.description: string array with all the human faces extracted from the document

mrz.description: types of mrz supported type1 and type3

ocr.description: value of JSON element varies on the type of document

PDF417.description: value of JSON element varies on the type of document

bar_codes.description: value of JSON array varies on the type of document

human_faces.description: contains a base64 encoded string array of human faces extracted from the document

hologram.description: contains results for hologram detection and validation,  if applicable. Mostly applicable for offline scanner SDK reponse
